page.title: 08Keeping fit in Solihull
page.content: David Lewis's mother used to work as a an{aerobics}teacher for an organisation called 'Fitness', though she now works for herself. She finds that people want to exercise much more than they used to and whereas boys have always had an advantage with gym clubs and cricket and football clubs, more girls and women are now able to exercise through aerobics and dance. She says that people want to exercise for the following reasons: for pleasure, as a competetive sport, to help maintain an ideal body weight, to relieve stress, to improve body shape and as a social pastime. She says that most people feel being slimmer not only makes them feel more attractive but helps them to cope better with life's stresses.
